subject: Cybersecurity
title: Evil Twin Attacks: The Fake Wi-Fi Trap
description: A short lesson to help you apply Evil Twin Attacks: The Fake Wi-Fi Trap.

hook.text: You connect to 'Starbucks_WiFi' and browse normally. But the hotspot was set up by someone at the next table.

buildup.text: An evil twin is a rogue access point that mimics a legitimate Wi-Fi network. Your device connects automatically.

discovery.text: All traffic through the evil twin is visible to the attacker. They can intercept passwords, inject malware, or.

twist.text: Your phone automatically reconnects to networks it has joined before. An attacker just needs to broadcast a common.

climax.text: Public Wi-Fi is inherently untrusted. Evil twins exploit that most people don't verify which network they're on.

punchline.text: The free Wi-Fi is free because you're paying with your data.

quiz.question: Why do evil twin attacks succeed so easily?
options: Devices automatically connect to networks with familiar names
They require physical access to the router
